comments:
Description:
Able to handle the failure soap response.
That means the web service can give may be two kinds of response, success response and failure response. But now our driver only parse the success response, and filter the failure response. 
Build number: 
2.2.0.v20070413-0630
Steps to reproduce:
1, New a WS Datasource from wsdl file:
   http://api.google.com/GoogleSearch.wsdl
2, New a WS Dataset, select doSpellingSuggestion operation.
3, Insert invalid parameter
   KEY: A
   Pharse: happy
4, Try to get the response
Expected result:
Because of the KEY is a google lisence key, so the wrong key can also get the failure response:
<SOAP-ENV:Envelope
    xmlns:SOAP-ENV="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"
    xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/1999/XMLSchema-instance"
    xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/1999/XMLSchema">
   - + <SOAP-ENV:Body>
      - + <SOAP-ENV:Fault>
         - + <faultcode>SOAP-ENV:Server</faultcode>
         - + <faultstring>Exception from service object: Invalid authorization key: a</faultstring>
         - + <faultactor>/search/beta2</faultactor>
         - + <detail>
            - + <stackTrace>com.google.soap.search.GoogleSearchFault: Invalid authorization key: a
	at com.google.soap.search.QueryLimits.lookUpAndLoadFromINSIfNeedBe(QueryLimits.java:213)
	at com.google.soap.search.QueryLimits.validateKey(QueryLimits.java:120)
	at com.google.soap.search.GoogleSearchService.doPublicMethodChecks(GoogleSearchService.java:847)
	at com.google.soap.search.GoogleSearchService.doSpellingSuggestion(GoogleSearchService.java:262)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor25.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.soap.server.RPCRouter.invoke(RPCRouter.java:146)
	at org.apache.soap.providers.RPCJavaProvider.invoke(RPCJavaProvider.java:129)
	at org.apache.soap.server.http.RPCRouterServlet.doPost(RPCRouterServlet.java:288)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:709)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:802)
	at com.google.gse.HttpConnection.runServlet(HttpConnection.java:436)
	at com.google.gse.HttpConnection.run(HttpConnection.java:376)
	at com.google.gse.DispatchQueue$WorkerThread.run(DispatchQueue.java:254)
Caused by: com.google.soap.search.UserKeyInvalidException: Base 64 did not decode correctly.
	at com.google.soap.search.UserKey.<init>(UserKey.java:62)
	at com.google.soap.search.QueryLimits.lookUpAndLoadFromINSIfNeedBe(QueryLimits.java:210)
	... 14 more
</stackTrace>
           </detail>
        </SOAP-ENV:Fault>
     </SOAP-ENV:Body>
  </SOAP-ENV:Envelope>
The user can get the failure response from the web service because it is also a kind of service which is supported.
Actual result:
The wrong parameter can not get the response web service supported
